channel.title: Posts on David Ado
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on David Ado

item.title: Go Programming Notes
item.description: This isn’t meant to be a comprehensive set of notes so I won’t be including much of the obvious stuff.

item.title: Scalable Systems Notes
item.description: The Basics Scalability is the property of a system to handle a growing amount of work by adding resources. Replication and Optimization Replication adds more resources (web servers, app servers, database replicas, etc).

item.title: Mysql 8.0 Notes
item.description: CONFIGURATION innodb_buffer_pool_size Most important parameter for caching data and indexes in memory. Can set as high as dataset. Otherwise, 80% of available RAM is a good starting point.

item.title: Hugo Quickstart
item.description: I’ve been dabbling with static site generators and I’ve been impressed with Hugo as it’s fairly straightforward. It only took a few days for me to convert the majority of my static sites to use Hugo and deploy them on Cloudflare which really showcases its ease of use.

item.title: Kubernetes Reference on Gcp
item.description: This is just a quick reference sheet for me to get something up and running on Google Cloud quickly so I’m writing this as if no one else is reading it…

item.title: Mysql 8.0 Backup and Replication Guide With Percona Xtrabackup 8.0
item.description: Percona’s Xtrabackup utility contains a few major changes in MySql 8.0 the most notable of which is the replacement of the innobackupex command with xtrabackup.

item.title: Mysql Replication Guide With Mysqldump
item.description: My step by step guide for setting up a replication server for MySql 5.6 and up (with GTID enabled) using mysqldump.

item.title: Typesense Reference
item.description: Whenever I need some sort of search engine, I often reach for Typesense over ElasticSearch due to its simplicity and ease of use as long as the dataset can fit into memory.

item.title: Git Reference
item.description: I’ve been using git for years now but there are commands I use every day while others, not so much.
